data.scheme_name: National SC-ST Hub  - Special Marketing Assistance Scheme (SMAS)  - Micro  - New
data.benefits: Scheme provides maximum reimbursement of Rs. 3 lakh for Participation in International Exhibitions/Trade Fairs Abroad.
data.eligibility: All units engaged in the manufacturing and service activities are eligible under the scheme.
data.conditions:
1. The SC/ST units may apply under SMAS at least a month in advance for domestic events and two months for international events. 
  2. SC/ST entrepreneurs shall be allowed reimbursement under SMAS for maximum of 2 (two) international events and 4 (four) domestic events in a financial year.
data.beneficiaries: All units engaged in the manufacturing and service activities are eligible under the scheme.
data.prerequisites:
1. The SC/ST units may apply under SMAS at least a month in advance for domestic events and two months for international events. 
  2. SC/ST entrepreneurs shall be allowed reimbursement under SMAS for maximum of 2 (two) international events and 4 (four) domestic events in a financial year.
data.context: National Small Industries Corporation, under National SC-ST Hub, launched Special Marketing Assistance Scheme specifically for SC/ST Enterprises for the enhancement of competitiveness and marketability of their products.
data.objective: This sub-scheme aims for the enhancement of competitiveness and marketability of the products of SCs/STs enterprises.
data.description:
1. For Participation in International Exhibitions/Trade Fairs Abroad: 
    • Built-up Stall Charges: 100% of minimum stall size. 
    • Airfare: 100% of economy class airfare (shortest route) for one SC/ST representative. 
    • Daily Allowance: Double of MEA specified daily allowance. 
    • Freight: Maximum Rs. 0.30 lakh. 
    • Maximum Budgetary Support: Rs. 3 lakh. 
  2. For Organizing Visits to International Exhibitions/Trade Fairs/Seminars/Workshops: 
    • Airfare: 100% of economy class airfare (shortest route) for one SC/ST representative. 
    • Daily Allowance: Double of MEA specified daily allowance. 
    • Maximum Budgetary Support: Rs. 1.50 lakh per SC/ST enterprise per event. 
  3. For Organizing Visits to Domestic Exhibitions/Trade Fairs/Seminars/Workshops: 
    • Fare: 100% actual fare (bus/train/air), up to Rs. 0.10 lakh.
  4. For Participation in Domestic Exhibitions/Trade Fairs: 
    • Built-up Stall Charges: 100% of minimum stall size.
    • Fare: 100% actual fare (bus/train/air), up to Rs. 0.10 lakh.
    • Freight: 100% transport charges for exhibits (up to Rs. 0.15 lakh). Maximum Budgetary Support: Rs. 1.50 lakh per SC/ST enterprise per event.
data.how_to_apply: Applications for participation in international/ domestic events, in the prescribed format, should be submitted to nearest NSSHOs/NSIC branch offices, at least a month in advance for domestic events and two months for international events.
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get the benefit after the approval from the concerned authority.
data.additional_info:
1. Payment to the SC-ST MSEs towards reimbursement of airfare/freight subsidy under SMAS will be made through PFMS. 
  2. SC-ST MSEs are required to submit a cancelled cheque (Proprietor/Partnership/Company as the case may be) at the time of submitting the application for participation in an exhibition.
data.checklist_info_a:
1. Self-certified copy of URC and GSTIN 
2. Self-certified copy of PAN card                                                                                                                                                          
3. Copy of Caste Certificate of proprietor/all partners/directors                                
4. Details of shareholding in case of partnership/ Private Limited/LLP firm 
5. Bank attested debit statement with PBG charges mentioning Bank Guarantee number and applicant MSEs name 
6. Bank attested and stamped copy of PBG issued by the Bank 
7. Cancelled cheque of the current account of the enterprise from which Bank charges have been debited 
8. Proof of transferred amount as reimbursement by National SC-ST Hub Office/National Small Industries Corporation.                                                                                                         
9. Supply Order/ Purchase Order/ Work Order from CPSE/ Central Government Organisation/ Department/ State PSE.                                                                                            
10. Udyam Registration Certificate (URC) 
11. Other KYC Documents
